extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulbs
extendedIngredients.original: 2 bulbs fennel, trimmed, cored and coarsely chopped
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 bulbs fennel, trimmed, cored and coarsely chopped

extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup oil-cured olives or kalamata olives, chopped
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup oil-cured olives or kalamata olives, chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: oil-cured olives or kalamata olives, chopped

extendedIngredients.name: orange bell peppers
extendedIngredients.original: 2 medium yellow and/or orange bell peppers, chopped
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 medium yellow and/or orange bell peppers, chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: yellow and/or orange bell peppers, chopped

extendedIngredients.name: wheat berries
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup farro or wheat berries (see Shopping Tip)

extendedIngredients.originalName: farro or wheat berries (see Shopping Tip)

extendedIngredients.name: white-wine vinegar

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons white balsamic vinegar or white-wine vinegar
extendedIngredients.originalName: white balsamic vinegar or white-wine vinegar

title: Roasted Fennel & Farro Salad
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F.Place farro (or wheat berries) in a large saucepan; add enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook until tender, 15 to 20 minutes for farro, about 1 hour for wheat berries.Meanwhile, toss fennel and bell peppers with oil, salt and pepper in a large roasting pan. Roast, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned and tender, 35 to 40 minutes.Drain the farro (or wheat berries); transfer to a large bowl. Add the roasted vegetables, olives, vinegar and thyme; stir to combine. Serve warm, room temperature or cold.

steps.step: Place farro (or wheat berries) in a large saucepan; add enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook until tender, 15 to 20 minutes for farro, about 1 hour for wheat berries.Meanwhile, toss fennel and bell peppers with oil, salt and pepper in a large roasting pan. Roast, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned and tender, 35 to 40 minutes.
Drain the farro (or wheat berries); transfer to a large bowl.
Add the roasted vegetables, olives, vinegar and thyme; stir to combine.
Serve warm, room temperature or cold.
